intro: Clidemia diffusa, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Clidemia diffusa is often found in moist, shaded environments and can become invasive in some regions.
